<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GLOBAL ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/22/developing-countries-face-economic-devastation-potential-famine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A “Perfect Storm” Brewing in the Developing World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wheat farmer in India" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODcvd2hlYXRfZmFybWVyX2luX2luZGlhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sameer Sehgal/Hindustan Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic is causing misery all across the globe. But authorities are warning that in developing countries, the consequences will be especially dire and could even trigger a second public health crisis: widespread famine. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The specifics</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, the UN's World Food Program released an alarming report on the potential for extreme food shortages in developing countries. On Tuesday, Executive Director David Beasley <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2020/apr/21/coronavirus-pandemic-will-cause-famine-of-biblical-proportions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pleaded with the UN Security Council</a> to support those countries financially. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lockdown restrictions have disrupted supply chains in developing countries, leading to drastic shortages. In Nairobi's largest slum, two people died in a stampede for flour and cooking oil.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beasley described the situation as a “perfect storm,” where a severe food shortage that existed before COVID-19 could nearly double from 135 million people at risk to 265 million by the end of the year. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Developing countries are more vulnerable</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both to the virus and to the economic destruction it brings<strong style="color:#000">. </strong> </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First, many lack the medical resources necessary to treat people. According to the OECD, African countries’ health budgets average $12 per citizen/year, in contrast to the UK’s $4,000. Ten African countries have no ventilators. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, core revenue streams like tourism, taxation, and remittances (payments sent by migrant workers back to people in their home countries) are drying up. The World Bank estimates that <a href="https://qz.com/1842775/world-bank-predicts-remittances-in-2020-to-fall-by-20-percent/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remittances will sink</a> by 20% this year—the biggest annual drop in recent history. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That loss of more than $100 billion will have major consequences for developing economies. Last year, remittances edged out foreign direct investment as the largest source of capital inflows to low- and middle-income countries, accounting for roughly 8.9% of GDP, the </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/471cb6b2-f354-4fe0-b36f-3078a506a2d8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FT reports</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some experts are working on fixes.</strong> Oxford University professor of globalization and development Ian Goldin proposed “<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2020/apr/21/coronavirus-disaster-developing-nations-global-marshall-plan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a global Marshall plan</a>” where 1) $44 billion in debt owed by African countries in 2020 would be erased and 2) richer countries would divert at least $2.5 trillion to poor countries.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/22/faced-epic-crisis-airlines-plan-future?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Turns Out It’s Bad For Airlines When No One Flies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Plane with one aisle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODQvcGxhbmVfd2l0aF9vbmVfYWlzbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Delta reported quarterly earnings yesterday and it’s worse than your first attempt at baking sourdough. A $607 million pretax loss—it’s first quarterly loss in five years—is ugly, but that’s just the beginning. The nation's biggest airline expects revenues to fall <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/airlines-have-secured-cash-but-not-their-future-11587565958?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">90% in Q2</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Onwards and upwards?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even as airlines hemorrhage money (Delta was burning through $100 million/day in late March), they are making preparations for when passengers return to the skies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s what <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-21/emirates-plans-vacant-seats-between-passengers-to-stop-virus?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Emirates thinks</a> an October flight to your buddy’s wedding could look like:</p> 
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Blocked off middle seats:</strong></span><span> You might have to shout to ask for your neighbor's pen to fill out the Sudoku. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">No magazines: </strong></span><span>Turns out you won't even need that pen.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Lots of gloves and masks: </strong></span><span>Flight personnel that come into contact with passengers, from boarding agents to cabin crew, will be required to wear personal protective equipment. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Or you could just redesign the whole thing. </strong>An Italian manufacturer reimagined a more sanitary airplane cabin, complete with glass partitions and an extremely awkward, <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/this-is-what-air-travel-could-look-like-in-a-post-coronavirus-world-2020-04-21?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reversed middle seat</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/22/harvard-university-criticized-relief-package-funds?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Harvard Succumbs to Perfidious Opprobrium
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/harvard-says-its-keeping-almost-9-million-in-stimulus-money-that-critics-like-trump-say-it-shouldnt-be-taking-2020-04-22?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a reckoning came</a> for the cash Harvard University was eligible to receive under last month’s coronavirus relief package. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Roll the tape: </strong>The university paper reported last week that Harvard would get almost $9 million through the CARES Act. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Then on Tuesday, President Trump said at a press briefing that Harvard “shouldn’t be taking it.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Many other critics cracked their knuckles and got to tweeting about a school with a $40.9 billion endowment receiving support. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Harvard <a href="https://twitter.com/Harvard/status/1252737743567888387?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">came back with</a>, “It’s more complicated than that. Let me explain.” In a tweet thread, the Harvard of eastern Massachusetts explained how the relief money would have come through a $14 billion higher education fund—not the Paycheck Protection Program, the fund for small businesses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...the damage was done. Harvard announced yesterday it would not accept the funds.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOLIDAYS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/22/ramadan-2020-presents-challenges-marketers-film-crews?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ramadan Mubarak
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Egyptian youths decorating their Cairo street for Ramadan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODYvY2Fpcm9fcmFtYWRhbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Khaled DeSouki/AFP/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just like Passover and Easter, Ramadan 2020 is <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/22/ramadan-in-a-time-of-plague-coronavirus-the-best-thing-is-to-stay-home-stay-quiet?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moving to Zoom</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ramadan, which starts tonight, is the holy month observed by Muslims around the world. Traditionally, it consists of daylong fasts, prayer, self-reflection, and donations to charity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s also a marketing tsunami,</strong> with social media usage and consumer spending <a href="https://blog.arcsncurves.com/blog/ramadan-social-media-marketing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surging</a> in the Middle East and parts of the Asia-Pacific region. Facebook publishes a <a href="https://www.facebook.com/business/m/sharedbyfacebook/insights?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">series of guides</a> for marketers focused on Ramadan, while Google even established an <a href="https://events.withgoogle.com/the-lantern-award-6/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">award</a> for the best Ramadan-related YouTube ad campaign. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We’re not McKinsey, but we’re guessing social media use will increase even more this year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Also different this year: </strong>The production schedules of wildly popular soap operas that entertain families in between fasts. Egypt’s TV industry can produce 80 serials for the month of Ramadan, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/17/middleeast/egypt-soap-operas-coronavirus-intl/index.html?utm_source=Eurasia+Group+Signal&utm_campaign=0195129da9-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2020_04_21_11_00&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e605619869-0195129da9-170107393&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNN reports</a>, but crews have been restricted from shooting by government lockdown measures.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which means the soap slate could be emptier this year. As of April 15, only a “handful” of shows were ready to air, <a href="https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2020/04/ramadan-shows-promise-comic-relief-amid-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Al-Monitor</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/22/15-years-youtube?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Happy 15th, YouTube
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="YouTube gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0X9Z3f6D41QKrnOf0/source.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="YouTube gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0X9Z3f6D41QKrnOf0/source.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s been 15 years to the day since YouTube cofounder Jawed Karim uploaded the platform's <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first-ever video</a>, 18 seconds of him pontificating about elephant trunks at the San Diego Zoo. Here’s a brief timeline on what’s happened since:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2005</strong>: YouTube launches its public beta in May, and with $3.5 million from Sequoia Capital it goes beyond beta by the end of the year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2006: </strong>Google acquires YouTube for $1.7 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2007: </strong>"<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_OBlgSz8sSM&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Charlie bit my finger</a>” becomes the first viral video, proving babies are cuter than cats, and YouTube goes mobile-friendly the same month the first iPhone hits stores. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2008: </strong>"<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dMH0bHeiRNg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Evolution of Dance</a>" gets a record-breaking 100 million views.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2009:</strong> Justin Bieber. Vevo. The music world is never the same. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2012: </strong>Psy’s “<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cGc_NfiTxng&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gangnam Style</a>” gets a historic 1 billion views.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2014: </strong>Susan Wojcicki becomes YouTube’s third CEO.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2017: </strong>The “<a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2017/09/18/adpocalypse-2017-heres-what-you-need-to-know-about-youtubes-demonetization-troubles/#7fee8be26c26?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Adpocalypse</a>” and “<a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/danidiplacido/2017/11/28/youtubes-elsagate-illuminates-the-unintended-horrors-of-the-digital-age/#776e882e6ba7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Elsagate</a>” throw the platform under public scrutiny.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As of last year, </strong>500 hours of video is uploaded to YouTube...<a href="https://www.statista.com/topics/2019/youtube/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">every minute</a>. There’s no sign of that number going down, especially <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/01/streaming-numbers-way-march?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">amid COVID-19</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Golf trick shot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=373 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/M61OSXLK5uKmk/source.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Golf trick shot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/M61OSXLK5uKmk/source.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sports fans: Whether you miss the agony of rooting for your team or the cathartic screaming that accompanies it, we’ve got you covered.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For agony,</strong> get into the trick shot game and learn the meaning of patience. You could be rewarded—ESPN is partnering with Facebook to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-22/next-sportscenter-top-10-could-feature-your-at-home-trick-shot?srnd=premium&sref=1crrKBaO" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">produce a weekly show</a> featuring the best fan-submitted videos. And each Wednesday, they'll throw one in SportsCenter's "Top 10." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If screaming is more your thing,</strong> Bud Light is encouraging you to support coronavirus relief efforts by <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/2020-nfl-draft-bud-light-gives-fans-a-chance-to-boo-roger-goodell-for-covid-19-relief-efforts/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">booing NFL commissioner Roger Goodell on Twitter</a> during tonight's draft. And finally, to combine agony and screaming, check out the "<a href="https://twitter.com/CaioBrighenti?mod=article_inline" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NFL Draft Boo Meter</a>" built by a bored college student. It will pull Reddit comments to measure fanbase sentiment over the course of the night. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/22/brews-bookshelf-april-23?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other Thursday, we're bringing you a few of the Brew's favorite business-related reads.</em></p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Inside story:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.simonandschuster.com/books/No-Filter/Sarah-Frier/9781982126803?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>No Filter</em></a></span><span> by Sarah Frier is a behind-the-scenes look at how Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger built Instagram. Sarah was a guest on our </span><span><em>Business Casual </em></span><span>podcast, and we can personally vouch for her whip-smart reporting and original storytelling. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Personal finance</strong></span><span>: </span><span><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/69571.Rich_Dad_Poor_Dad?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Rich Dad, Poor Dad</em></a></span><span> by Robert Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter is one of the best-selling personal finance books of all time, told through the stories of, you guessed it, a rich dad and a poor dad. If you're looking to boost your financial literacy, start here. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Normally we'd list a third book rec, but today we've got a surprise. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA “Perfect Storm” Brewing in the Developing World\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Wheat farmer in India\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODcvd2hlYXRfZmFybWVyX2luX2luZGlhLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSameer Sehgal/Hindustan Times via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus pandemic is causing misery all across the globe. But authorities are warning that in developing countries, the consequences will be especially dire and could even trigger a second public health crisis: widespread famine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe specifics\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, the UN's World Food Program released an alarming report on the potential for extreme food shortages in developing countries. On Tuesday, Executive Director David Beasley \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2020/apr/21/coronavirus-pandemic-will-cause-famine-of-biblical-proportions?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epleaded with the UN Security Council\u003c/a\u003e to support those countries financially. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLockdown restrictions have disrupted supply chains in developing countries, leading to drastic shortages. In Nairobi's largest slum, two people died in a stampede for flour and cooking oil.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeasley described the situation as a “perfect storm,” where a severe food shortage that existed before COVID-19 could nearly double from 135 million people at risk to 265 million by the end of the year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eDeveloping countries are more vulnerable\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth to the virus and to the economic destruction it brings\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e. \u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst, many lack the medical resources necessary to treat people. According to the OECD, African countries’ health budgets average $12 per citizen/year, in contrast to the UK’s $4,000. Ten African countries have no ventilators. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, core revenue streams like tourism, taxation, and remittances (payments sent by migrant workers back to people in their home countries) are drying up. The World Bank estimates that \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1842775/world-bank-predicts-remittances-in-2020-to-fall-by-20-percent/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremittances will sink\u003c/a\u003e by 20% this year—the biggest annual drop in recent history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat loss of more than $100 billion will have major consequences for developing economies. Last year, remittances edged out foreign direct investment as the largest source of capital inflows to low- and middle-income countries, accounting for roughly 8.9% of GDP, the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/471cb6b2-f354-4fe0-b36f-3078a506a2d8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFT reports\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome experts are working on fixes.\u003c/strong\u003e Oxford University professor of globalization and development Ian Goldin proposed “\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2020/apr/21/coronavirus-disaster-developing-nations-global-marshall-plan?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea global Marshall plan\u003c/a\u003e” where 1) $44 billion in debt owed by African countries in 2020 would be erased and 2) richer countries would divert at least $2.5 trillion to poor countries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust like Passover and Easter, Ramadan 2020 is \u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRamadan, which starts tonight, is the holy month observed by Muslims around the world. Traditionally, it consists of daylong fasts, prayer, self-reflection, and donations to charity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s also a marketing tsunami,\u003c/strong\u003e with social media usage and consumer spending \u003ca href=\"https://blog.arcsncurves.com/blog/ramadan-social-media-marketing?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurging\u003c/a\u003e in the Middle East and parts of the Asia-Pacific region. Facebook publishes a \u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/m/sharedbyfacebook/insights?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseries of guides\u003c/a\u003e for marketers focused on Ramadan, while Google even established an \u003ca href=\"https://events.withgoogle.com/the-lantern-award-6/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaward\u003c/a\u003e for the best Ramadan-related YouTube ad campaign. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe’re not McKinsey, but we’re guessing social media use will increase even more this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAlso different this year: \u003c/strong\u003eThe production schedules of wildly popular soap operas that entertain families in between fasts. Egypt’s TV industry can produce 80 serials for the month of Ramadan, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/17/middleeast/egypt-soap-operas-coronavirus-intl/index.html?utm_source=Eurasia+Group+Signal\u0026utm_campaign=0195129da9-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2020_04_21_11_00\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_term=0_e605619869-0195129da9-170107393\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCNN reports\u003c/a\u003e, but crews have been restricted from shooting by government lockdown measures.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich means the soap slate could be emptier this year.
